Hi David,

Would it be possible to download a jar archive instead of an exe=
 file?

I would be happy to try JAM*Tester under Linux.

	Daniel

Le mer 30=
/06/2004 =E0 21:51, xcare87x a =E9crit :
> Hello JUnit Community,
> 
> My n=
ame is David Poll.  I'm a 16-year-old high school student at Troy 
> High S=
chool, in Fullerton, CA (Class of '05).  Over the past half-
> year or so, =
I have been working with my AP Computer Science teacher, 
> Dave Wittry, on=
 a project to make JUnit testing more accessible to 
> both teachers and st=
udents called JAM*Tester (JUnit Auto-Matic 
> Tester).
> 
> We just recentl=
y released the Student Version of our tool, which may 
> be useful to more =
than just students.  Its goal is to aid in the 
> creation of JUnit TestCas=
es.  It also runs the tests and reports 
> JUnit results.  Additionally, it=
 provides some code-coverage 
> reporting, which can be extremely useful (f=
yi: code-coverage provided 
> in part by Clover http://www.thecortex.net/cl=
over).
> 
> Additionally, we have the Teacher Version of the tool.  The ide=
a 
> behind this is that a Teacher can create a battery of tests for their =

> students' labs (possibly using the Student Version), and then 
> automat=
ically compile and run the tests for all of their students at 
> once.
> 
>=
 If you're interested, please come to our website, 
> http://www.jamtester.=
com.  We would appreciate any feedback you may 
> have for us.
> 
> Thanks =
in advance for your support,
> David
